p: The fractionation of human breast milk was performed as previously described [ 35]. Briefly, 10 mL pooled thawed breast milk was centrifuged for 20 min at 10,000–20,000× g at 4 °C to skim the fat (cream) from milk. Next, cream was resuspended in 10 mL PBS and the skim milk was ultracentrifuged at 100,000× g for 90 min at 4 °C to separate caseins from serum proteins. The casein-containing pellet was resuspended in 10 mL PBS and the supernatant (whey) was collected.
